17.summary:
The document outlines various discount programs available for diabetic supplies, physical therapy, and hearing aids. For diabetic supplies, customers can receive discounts ranging from 20% to 85% off retail prices. This includes brand name glucose test strips, glucose monitors, lancets, and other devices such as blood pressure monitors and urinalysis test strips. The program provides a customer service contact number and billing information for further assistance.

In the physical therapy and rehabilitation section, the program offers an average savings of 20% at over 1,200 offices with 4,000 rehabilitation and physical therapy providers across 23 states. This section also provides customer service and billing contact details for program access and provider location.

The hearing savings program includes free hearing consultations and exclusive discounts on the latest hearing aid technology. Benefits include free annual hearing consultations at over 3,000 professional locations, exclusive discounts on all hearing aid technologies and styles, a free deluxe warranty program, and up to a 3-year supply of batteries, with 40 cells provided per hearing aid purchased per year. Contact information is provided for customer service and billing inquiries.

18.summary: The document outlines a program for medical bill negotiations and discounts on medical supplies and equipment. Members can potentially save on medical bills that are not covered by their existing plan benefits. Patient advocates assist in negotiating the costs, requiring full payment to the provider or facility once a negotiation is accepted. A minimum bill of $5000 is necessary to initiate the negotiation process. Additionally, the program offers savings ranging from 20% to 50% on various medical supplies. These supplies include ambulatory aids, bathroom safety items, wheelchairs, scooters, and hospital beds, among others. The program emphasizes that it is not insurance but a discount program, providing members with cost-saving opportunities on medical expenses and supplies.

19.summary:
The Laboratory Savings Program provides an efficient, affordable, and confidential solution for medical laboratory testing. Members can access a wide array of medical laboratory tests, gaining information on both tests and diseases. The program allows members to purchase medical lab tests directly from the website. However, it is important to note that this program is not available in New York, New Jersey, or Rhode Island. For assistance, customer service can be reached at 877-271-6559, and billing inquiries can be directed to 732-876-9733. More information and provider locations can be found at www.ncegapaffordplus.com.

SDO Nutrition offers support for achieving personal health goals, maintaining a healthy lifestyle, and managing chronic health conditions through food and diet education. The program provides services for weight loss, dietary restrictions, geriatric health, diabetes and high blood pressure management, chronic health conditions management, and nutrition for athletic and fitness training. Similar to the Laboratory Savings Program, customer service and billing contacts are available, and further details can be accessed through the provided website link.

20.summary:
The document outlines two distinct services: speech therapy and a 24/7 nurse help line. The speech therapy service utilizes video conferencing technology to provide live, one-on-one, highly individualized, and interactive sessions. This telepractice model offers an alternative to traditional speech therapy, requiring only a computer, high-speed internet, a web camera, and a quiet room. During scheduled sessions, therapists engage with clients using therapeutic activities and exercises. Additional materials and follow-up resources are provided to help patients practice skills learned during sessions.

The 24/7 nurse help line offers round-the-clock access to registered nurses (RNs) for family health issues. This service includes assistance in over 100 languages, providing medical information and support. Both services emphasize accessibility and convenience, with customer service and billing contact information provided for further assistance. The document highlights the innovative approach of these services, focusing on ease of access and the broad range of support available.

21.summary:
The Chiropractic Savings Program provides members with a free initial consultation and offers up to 50% savings on diagnostic services and x-rays if necessary. Additionally, members can enjoy unlimited treatments with up to 30% savings through a national network of over 12,000 chiropractors. This program is designed to make chiropractic care more accessible and affordable for members. 

In addition to chiropractic savings, the program includes discounts on vitamins and supplements. Members can save up to 75% off retail pricing on a wide selection of natural products, including vitamins and supplements. This aspect of the program aims to support members in maintaining their overall health and wellness through affordable access to essential health products. 

For further assistance, members can contact customer service at 877-271-6559 or billing at 732-876-9733. To access the program and locate providers, members are directed to visit www.ncegapaffordplus.com. It is important to note that this program is not provided by AccessOne DMPO and is a discount program, not insurance.

22.summary:
The Health Discount Program Member Agreement outlines the terms and conditions for participants in the GapAfford Plus discount medical plan, provided by AccessOne Consumer Health, Inc. This agreement specifies that the plan is not insurance but offers discounts at certain healthcare providers for medical services. Members are responsible for paying for all healthcare services, with discounts applied by contracted providers. The plan does not make direct payments to providers. Participants can access discounts on services from chiropractors, medical equipment suppliers, rehabilitation services, hearing services, labs, and pharmacies, with discounts ranging from 5% to 70%. Dental and vision services are also available at discounted rates.

The agreement details the effective date of enrollment, which is shown on the Member ID, and the process for monthly payments. Members can cancel their participation within thirty days for a full refund of membership fees, minus any processing fees. After thirty days, cancellation is possible with a pro-rata refund for unused months. The plan includes coverage for dependent children at no additional charge. Members are encouraged to keep a copy of the agreement for their records.

The document emphasizes that this plan is not intended to replace health insurance and does not meet minimum creditable coverage requirements under certain laws. It is not a Qualified Health Plan under the Affordable Care Act and is not a Medicare prescription drug plan. The agreement also includes contact information for complaints and further inquiries.

23.summary: This page provides information about a discount program offered by National Benefit Builders, Inc. It is important to note that this program is not insurance but rather a discount program designed to offer savings on various services. The page is intended for agent use only, indicating that it contains specific details relevant to those selling or managing the program. The program is accredited by the Better Business Bureau, which may provide assurance of its credibility and reliability. The page does not contain specific details about the benefits, coverage, or cost structures, as it primarily serves as an informational piece about the nature of the program itself.

9.summary: The NCE Discount Benefit Program Member Handbook provides an overview of the benefits available to members, emphasizing the inclusion of limited medical benefits alongside valuable discount benefits. This program is designed to offer members access to a range of discounts, enhancing their overall healthcare experience. The handbook highlights that this is not an insurance program but a discount program, which aims to supplement existing medical coverage by providing cost-saving opportunities. Members can take advantage of various discounts on medical services, potentially reducing out-of-pocket expenses. The document serves as a guide for understanding the scope of benefits and how they can be utilized effectively. It is important for members to note that while the program offers significant discounts, it does not replace traditional insurance coverage. Instead, it acts as a supplementary benefit to enhance affordability and access to healthcare services. The handbook encourages members to explore the full range of discounts available and integrate them into their healthcare planning.

10.summary:
This document serves as the table of contents for a health discount program, outlining various services and savings opportunities available to members. The program includes a range of benefits such as dental and vision services, pharmacy discounts, and brand-name mail-order options. Additionally, members can access savings on CBD products, diabetic supplies, and physical therapy and rehabilitation services. The program also offers a hearing savings program and medical bill negotiation services to assist members in managing healthcare costs. 

Further benefits include access to medical supplies and equipment, laboratory savings programs, and nutrition services. Speech therapy and a 24/7 nurse help line are also available, providing support and guidance for members. The chiropractic savings plan and discounts on vitamins and supplements offer additional health and wellness benefits. Finally, the document includes a health discount program member agreement, detailing the terms and conditions of membership.

11.summary:
The GapAfford Plus program is designed to help individuals and families save on out-of-pocket medical expenses, regardless of their current insurance status. This program offers savings from the first dollar spent, with no limits, by providing access to pre-negotiated rates similar to those received by insurance companies. It is particularly beneficial for people with high deductible health plans, no insurance, or those who are under-insured. Additionally, it caters to individuals who cannot obtain insurance due to pre-existing conditions, those whose plans do not cover certain procedures, and those in their eligibility waiting period. The program is also suitable for individuals on COBRA, with the advantage of no medical exam required for approval.

The program does not include deductibles, pre-existing condition limitations, medical exams, claim forms, usage limitations, or age restrictions, except for work already in progress. It is a reduced fee-for-service program and not an insurance plan. All household members are included, regardless of age, including students away at college. Participants can enroll even if they have existing insurance, provided their provider accepts both. It is important to note that this program does not meet the requirements of the PPACA, and participants must pay for services at the time they are rendered. Discounts are available when using participating providers.

The program is not available in Alaska, Montana, Rhode Island, Utah, Vermont, and Washington. For further assistance, customer service and billing contact numbers are provided, along with a website for accessing the program and locating providers.

12.summary:
The document outlines the benefits of the GapAfford Plus program, which provides access to the Aetna Dental Access Network. This network includes over 262,000 dental practice locations across the United States, offering significant savings on dental services. Members can expect to save between 15-50% per visit on services such as cleanings, x-rays, fillings, root canals, crowns, bridges, and orthodontia. The program is designed to be user-friendly, with no waiting periods, age restrictions, or pre-existing condition exclusions, except for work already in progress. There are no benefit maximums, and the program includes cosmetic dentistry and orthodontia. Additionally, it can be used alongside existing dental insurance to enhance coverage, and vision discounts are also included.

The document provides a sample table of dental care savings, comparing the regional average costs by Aetna with the costs through Dentachoice. For example, a periodic oral exam costs $73 on average, but with Dentachoice, it is reduced to $35, resulting in a total savings of $38. Similarly, a root canal molar, excluding final restoration, costs $1,226 on average, but with Dentachoice, the cost is $859, saving $367. The total savings for comprehensive orthodontic treatment is $2,468, with the average cost being $5,952 and the Dentachoice cost at $3,484.

13.summary:
The OUTLOOK Vision network offers a wide range of discounts and savings through a network of over 12,000 eye care locations nationwide. This network includes ophthalmologists, optometrists, independent optical centers, and national chain locations. The vision program provides savings ranging from 10% to 50% on most prescription eyeglasses, frames, and lenses. Additionally, there are savings on contact lenses, excluding disposables, at participating retail locations. Discounts of 10% to 30% are also available on medical eye exams and surgical procedures such as PRK and LASIK, where available and approved.

A sample of vision care savings is provided, illustrating potential savings at various locations. For example, at Exact Eye Care in Kearney, NE, a frame single vision with polycarbonate lenses has a retail price of $129.00, with a member price of $90.30, resulting in a savings of 30%. Similarly, at LensCrafters in Mesa, AZ, a frame single vision with photo flex tint is available at a member price of $104.96, offering a savings of 30% from the retail price of $149.95.

The document also lists some participating vision care providers, including Pearle Vision, Sears Optical, J.C. Penney Optical, and LensCrafters, among others. These providers are part of a larger network that offers thousands of vision centers participating in the program. The program is not available in certain states, including Alaska, Montana, Rhode Island, Utah, Vermont, and Washington.

14.summary:
The pharmacy discount program offers significant savings on prescription medications, allowing users to save an average of 55% on generic drugs and 15% on brand-name drugs. This program is accepted at over 80% of pharmacies across the United States, providing a wide national network for users. All FDA-approved drugs, including lifestyle medications, are available at reduced rates. The program does not limit the number of prescriptions that can be filled, offering flexibility and convenience to users.

The card is pre-activated and never expires, allowing immediate use without the need for activation or filling out forms. It covers the entire household with no exclusions, ensuring that all family members can benefit from the discounts. Additionally, personal information is never collected from the card user, maintaining privacy and security. The card can be used repeatedly, and it also includes discounts on pet medications.

To access the discounts, users simply present their member ID card to the pharmacist along with their prescription. The program emphasizes ease of use and accessibility, with no additional steps required to receive the benefits.

15.summary:
The RX Mail-Order program by MedAfford Global offers significant savings on prescription medications, with potential discounts of up to 80% and insulin medication savings of 45% or more. This service is designed to be convenient, easy, and secure for users. The process involves three main steps: pricing the medication online, placing an order via phone or online, and receiving the medications directly at home. A valid prescription from a doctor is required to complete the order. 

The document provides a list of commonly ordered brand-name medications, including Abilify 10mg at $160 and Advair Diskus 50/250mcg 180 doses at $144, among others. It also lists generic medications such as Amlodipine 10mg for $20 and Lisinopril 20mg for $22. Prices are based on a 90-day supply and do not include a $4.95 shipping fee or insurance costs. 

This program is not insurance but a discount program administered by National Benefit Builders, Inc. It emphasizes the ease of ordering and the direct shipment of medications, ensuring users receive email confirmations of their orders.

16.summary:
This page introduces the benefits of incorporating CBD into daily health routines, emphasizing its natural ingredients and the purest form of Cannabidiol. It highlights CBD as a safe and effective alternative to prescription painkillers for individuals and pets. The document explains that CBD, or cannabidiol, is a non-intoxicating compound found in hemp plants, which may support a sense of peace and balance. The text reassures users that CBD can be added to daily routines without altering the state of mind, promoting a healthier and happier future through natural relief.

The page outlines the unique aspects of the CBD products offered, including compliance with the Farm Bill Act of 2018 and the use of high-quality, pharmacist-formulated full-spectrum CBD products. It emphasizes the purity and potency of ingredients, supported by multi-stage third-party lab testing. Additionally, each package includes QR codes linked to lab results, ensuring transparency and quality assurance for consumers. The document serves as a resource for individuals seeking to learn more about supporting their health with CBD products.

1.summary: This document provides an overview of the insurance offerings by Everest Reinsurance Company, specifically focusing on the Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance plan. The plan is offered through NCE and utilizes the Multiplan PPO Network, providing a structured approach to healthcare coverage. The insurance type is designed to offer fixed benefits for various medical services, allowing policyholders to manage their healthcare expenses effectively. The plan is tailored to meet the needs of individuals seeking predictable and defined benefits for specific medical services. The use of the Multiplan PPO Network ensures access to a wide range of healthcare providers, enhancing the flexibility and accessibility of medical services for policyholders. This network option is particularly beneficial for those who prioritize having a broad selection of healthcare professionals and facilities. The document highlights the carrier, Everest, as a reliable provider of reinsurance solutions, emphasizing their commitment to offering structured and accessible insurance options. The plan's features are designed to cater to individuals looking for a fixed indemnity approach, providing clarity and predictability in their healthcare coverage.

2.summary:
This page outlines the features of Group Indemnity Insurance, which provides fixed payments to help manage expenses arising from medical costs. The insurance is designed to supplement existing coverage and provide cash to cover medical and living expenses. An example is provided where a 35-year-old woman incurs expenses after an accident, including a hospital admission benefit of $1,000, an ER admission benefit of $100, a hospital confinement benefit of $2,000, and a physician office benefit of $75, totaling $3,175. 

The page emphasizes the flexibility of using the benefits for various expenses such as major medical copays, deductibles, transportation, child care, and housekeeping. It highlights the advantages of choosing Everest Group Indemnity Insurance, including access to a Multiplan PPO Network, direct payment of benefits, and a fast claims process. 

It is noted that payouts are estimates and not guaranteed, with variations possible based on individual circumstances and plan offerings. The page advises consulting policy documents for a complete description of benefits, exclusions, limitations, and conditions of coverage. Everest products are described as limited benefit policies, not intended to substitute for major medical insurance.

3.summary:
The document provides detailed information on the Group Fixed Indemnity Plan, comparing Plan 100, Plan 200, Plan 200+, and Plan 300. Each plan offers specific benefits and coverage limits, with a focus on confinement, hospital, procedure, and outpatient benefits. All plans have a 12-12 pre-existing condition limitation, meaning conditions treated within 12 months prior to the effective date are excluded for the first 12 months of coverage. The underwriting level for all plans is guaranteed issue.

Confinement benefits vary by plan, with hospital confinement offering $100 per day for Plan 100, $200 for Plan 200 and Plan 200+, and $300 for Plan 300. ICU confinement benefits are $100 for Plan 100, $200 for Plan 200 and Plan 200+, and $300 for Plan 300. Hospital benefits include emergency room coverage of $50 per visit across all plans, with Plan 200+ and Plan 300 offering additional surgery benefits for up to three days per certificate year.

Procedure benefits are not available for Plan 100 and Plan 200, while Plan 200+ and Plan 300 provide combined inpatient and outpatient surgery benefits at $250 per day. Outpatient benefits include lab and X-ray services, with varying coverage across plans. Plan 100 offers physician's office visits at $50 per visit, while Plan 200 and Plan 200+ include additional lab and X-ray benefits.

The document also highlights specific limitations, such as the exclusion of chiropractic and acupuncture coverage, and emphasizes that benefits are per person. Policy terms and conditions may vary by state, and the document advises consulting the certificate for detailed information.

4.summary:
The document provides detailed information on the Group Fixed Indemnity Plan, comparing four different plans: Plan 500, Plan 750, Plan 1000, and Plan 1000+. Each plan outlines specific benefits, coverage limits, and cost structures. The plans are designed with guaranteed issue underwriting and include a 12-12 pre-existing condition limitation. Confinement benefits vary, with hospital confinement coverage ranging from $500 in Plan 500 to $1000 in Plan 1000+. ICU confinement benefits are similarly structured, increasing with each plan tier.

Hospital benefits include emergency room visits, with Plan 500 covering $50 per visit and Plan 1000+ covering $100. Procedure benefits such as surgery and anesthesia are also detailed, with surgery benefits combining inpatient and outpatient coverage, ranging from $350 per day in Plan 500 to $500 per day in Plan 1000+. Anesthesia is consistently covered at 25% across all plans.

Outpatient benefits cover lab tests, X-rays, advanced diagnostics, and physician's office visits, with coverage amounts increasing from $50 in Plan 500 to $100 in Plan 1000+. The document also highlights specific limitations, such as the exclusion of chiropractic or acupuncture coverage and the absence of a cancellation age. Benefits are per person, and policy terms, conditions, exclusions, and limitations may vary by state.

5.summary:
The document provides an overview of Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance, a supplemental health plan that offers a fixed monetary benefit for specific covered medical expenses. This type of insurance is also referred to as indemnity insurance, fixed benefit insurance, or fee-for-service insurance. It is designed to supplement existing health coverage by providing additional financial support for certain medical services. 

Participating providers can be found through the website www.ncegapaffordplus.com or by calling the provided phone number. Members can access plan discounts at participating providers within the network. The document also explains advanced diagnostics, which include a range of tests such as Angiogram, Arteriogram, Bone Marrow Test, and various types of scans like CT, MRI, and PET. 

The term 'Calendar Year' is defined as the period from January 1st to December 31st of any given year, while 'Certificate Year' refers to the plan year as shown in the Certificate Schedule. A free look period is available within 10 days after receiving the Certificate, allowing the holder to return it for any reason. 

Confinement is defined as being admitted to a hospital for inpatient services, with benefits paid per day of confinement. Diagnostic care encompasses a wide range of medical services aimed at diagnosing medical conditions. The MultiPlan PPO Network is highlighted as a nationwide network providing access to additional providers who offer discounted services.

6.summary:
This document outlines the exclusions and limitations associated with the insurance plan, specifying services, supplies, and treatments that are not considered covered. It states that no benefits will be payable for expenses related to certain types of surgeries and treatments unless otherwise expressed. Breast surgery, including capsular contraction, augmentation, or reduction mammoplasty, is excluded except for specific medically necessary cases related to cancer treatment. Cosmetic surgery is not covered unless it is reconstructive and necessary due to trauma or disease. Dental care is excluded except for accidental injury treatment within 12 months of a covered accident. 

The document further excludes benefits for elective treatments, experimental or investigational treatments, and injuries resulting from extreme sports. It specifies that no benefits are payable for treatments received from family members or for services incurred outside the United States unless under specific emergency conditions. The exclusions also cover activities such as skydiving, hang-gliding, and other high-risk sports, as well as treatments received while participating in certain professional or extreme activities. 

These limitations are crucial for understanding the scope of coverage and ensuring that policyholders are aware of the specific conditions under which benefits are not payable. The document emphasizes the importance of recognizing these exclusions to avoid unexpected expenses.

7.summary:
This document outlines specific exclusions and limitations on coverage for various conditions and activities under the insurance plan. It specifies that no benefits are payable for treatments related to gender-related services, including gender reassignment and treatments aimed at enhancing sexual energy or performance. Additionally, injuries sustained during hazardous activities or occupations, such as professional sports or activities involving compensation, are not covered. Losses resulting from illegal acts or while the insured person is incarcerated are also excluded from coverage.

The plan further excludes coverage for losses incurred while the insured person is intoxicated, with intoxication being conclusively determined by specific legal blood alcohol levels. Treatments deemed not medically necessary are not payable. Mental illness and substance abuse treatments are generally excluded, except for specific benefits outlined in the plan's benefit provisions. Losses due to narcotic use are not covered unless prescribed by a physician.

Overdose-related medical conditions are excluded unless the substance was administered under medical advice. Pregnancy-related treatments, except in life-threatening situations, are not covered, with complications treated as any other sickness. Finally, losses incurred while participating in military actions are not covered, including non-military support roles with international organizations.

8.summary:
This document outlines specific exclusions and limitations associated with the insurance plan. It details that no benefits are payable for manipulations of the musculoskeletal system or acupuncture, particularly when related to nerve interference or vertebral subluxation. Sports-related injuries, especially those from intercollegiate or professional athletics, are not covered, although local community sports activities are excluded from this limitation. Additionally, losses caused by suicide or intentional injury, even if unintended, are not covered.

The document specifies that accidents involving an unlicensed driver are not covered unless the driver holds a valid learner's permit and is under instruction. Losses due to war, riots, or acts of terrorism are also excluded, with specific conditions outlined for coverage. Weight-related treatments, including surgeries and nutritional counseling, are not covered unless deemed medically necessary.

Workers' compensation-related conditions are excluded from coverage. Pre-existing conditions are not covered for a period of 12 months, with exceptions for newborn or adopted children. A waiting period is required before certain benefits become payable, with specific provisions for newborn or adopted children. These exclusions and limitations are crucial for understanding the scope of coverage provided by the insurance plan.

presentation.content:
**Cover (1 slide)**
- **Plan Name:** Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance
- **Tagline:** "Predictable Benefits, Flexible Access"

**Plan Overview (1 slide)**
- **Target Audience:** Individuals seeking structured healthcare coverage
- **Offerings:** Fixed benefits for medical services, access to Multiplan PPO Network
- **Key Benefits:** Predictability in expenses, broad provider access, enhanced flexibility

**Core Plan Elements (2-3 slides)**
- **Coverage Areas:** Physician services, hospitalization, virtual visits
- **Plan Structure:** Tiered options with fixed payments, co-pays, and visit limits
- **Eligibility:** Individuals, focus on affordability and accessibility

**Common Service Features (2-3 slides)**
- **Provider Networks:** Access to Multiplan PPO Network
- **Claims Management:** Direct payment of benefits, fast claims process
- **Support Tools:** Wellness programs, advocacy services

**Plan Tiers Breakdown (8-12 slides)**

- **Plan 100**
  - **Benefits:**
    - Hospital Confinement: $100 per day
    - ICU Confinement: $100 per day
    - Emergency Room: $50 per visit
    - Physician's Office: $50 per visit
    - Exclusions: Procedure benefits not available

- **Plan 200**
  - **Benefits:**
    - Hospital Confinement: $200 per day
    - ICU Confinement: $200 per day
    - Emergency Room: $50 per visit
    - Physician's Office: $50 per visit
    - Additional: X-Rays & Labs, Advanced Diagnostic

- **Plan 200+**
  - **Benefits:**
    - Hospital Confinement: $200 per day
    - ICU Confinement: $200 per day
    - Emergency Room: $50 per visit
    - Physician's Office: $50 per visit
    - Additional: Surgery benefits, X-Rays & Labs, Advanced Diagnostic

- **Plan 300**
  - **Benefits:**
    - Hospital Confinement: $300 per day
    - ICU Confinement: $300 per day
    - Emergency Room: $50 per visit
    - Physician's Office: $50 per visit
    - Additional: Surgery benefits, X-Rays & Labs, Advanced Diagnostic

- **Plan 500**
  - **Benefits:**
    - Hospital Confinement: $500 per day
    - ICU Confinement: $500 per day
    - Emergency Room: $50 per visit
    - Physician's Office: $50 per visit
    - Additional: Surgery benefits, X-Rays & Labs, Advanced Diagnostic

- **Plan 750**
  - **Benefits:**
    - Hospital Confinement: $750 per day
    - ICU Confinement: $750 per day
    - Emergency Room: $75 per visit
    - Physician's Office: $50 per visit
    - Additional: Surgery benefits, X-Rays & Labs, Advanced Diagnostic

- **Plan 1000**
  - **Benefits:**
    - Hospital Confinement: $1000 per day
    - ICU Confinement: $1000 per day
    - Emergency Room: $100 per visit
    - Physician's Office: $75 per visit
    - Additional: Surgery benefits, X-Rays & Labs, Advanced Diagnostic

- **Plan 1000+**
  - **Benefits:**
    - Hospital Confinement: $1000 per day
    - ICU Confinement: $1000 per day
    - Emergency Room: $100 per visit
    - Physician's Office: $75 per visit
    - Additional: Hospital Admission, Surgery benefits, X-Rays & Labs, Advanced Diagnostic

**Comparison Slides (Markdown Table)**

| Benefit Category         | Plan 100 | Plan 200 | Plan 200+ | Plan 300 | Plan 500 | Plan 750 | Plan 1000 | Plan 1000+ |
|--------------------------|----------|----------|-----------|----------|----------|----------|-----------|------------|
| Hospital Confinement     | $100     | $200     | $200      | $300     | $500     | $750     | $1000     | $1000      |
| ICU Confinement          | $100     | $200     | $200      | $300     | $500     | $750     | $1000     | $1000      |
| Emergency Room           | $50      | $50      | $50       | $50      | $50      | $75      | $100      | $100       |
| Physician's Office       | $50      | $50      | $50       | $50      | $50      | $50      | $75       | $75        |
| Surgery Benefits         | N/A      | N/A      | Yes       | Yes      | Yes      | Yes      | Yes       | Yes        |
| X-Rays & Labs            | N/A      | Yes      | Yes       | Yes      | Yes      | Yes      | Yes       | Yes        |
| Advanced Diagnostic      | N/A      | Yes      | Yes       | Yes      | Yes      | Yes      | Yes       | Yes        |
| Hospital Admission       | N/A      | N/A      | N/A       | N/A      | N/A      | N/A      | N/A       | Yes        |

**Limitations and Exclusions (1-2 slides)**
- **Exclusions:** Pre-existing conditions, elective treatments, experimental treatments
- **Limitations:** Waiting periods, specific exclusions for high-risk activities

**Key Takeaways and Action Steps (1 slide)**
- **Flexibility:** Multiple plan tiers to suit different needs
- **Cost vs. Coverage:** Balance between affordability and benefits
- **Next Steps:** Enrollment process, contact support for assistance

**Thank You (1 slide)**
- **Message:** "Thank you for considering Everest Reinsurance Group for your healthcare needs. We are committed to providing structured and accessible insurance options."

script.content:
---- Cover ----

Hello, everyone! Thank you for joining today's session. We'll walk through the Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance plan's features and benefits that empower your health with financial peace of mind. Let's get started!

---- Plan Overview ----

This plan is designed for individuals seeking structured healthcare coverage. It offers fixed benefits for medical services and access to the Multiplan Preferred Provider Organization (PPO) Network. The key benefits include predictability in expenses, broad provider access, and enhanced flexibility.

---- Core Plan Elements (One of Three) ----

Let's explore the core elements of this plan. The coverage areas include physician services, hospitalization, and virtual visits. This ensures you have access to essential healthcare services when you need them.

---- Core Plan Elements (Two of Three) ----

The plan structure is tiered, offering options with fixed payments, co-pays, and visit limits. This tiered approach allows you to choose the level of coverage that best suits your needs.

---- Core Plan Elements (Three of Three) ----

Eligibility is open to individuals, with a focus on affordability and accessibility. This makes it easier for you to find a plan that fits your budget and healthcare requirements.

---- Common Service Features (One of Three) ----

Now, let's discuss the common service features. You have access to the Multiplan PPO Network, which provides a wide range of healthcare providers to choose from.

---- Common Service Features (Two of Three) ----

The claims management system offers direct payment of benefits and a fast claims process. This ensures that you receive your benefits quickly and efficiently.

---- Common Service Features (Three of Three) ----

Support tools include wellness programs and advocacy services, providing additional resources to help you manage your health and navigate the healthcare system.

---- Plan Tiers Breakdown (Plan 100) ----

Let's examine our first plan tier, Plan 100. It offers hospital confinement benefits of one hundred dollars per day and intensive care unit (ICU) confinement benefits of one hundred dollars per day. Emergency room visits are covered at fifty dollars per visit, and physician's office visits are also fifty dollars per visit. However, procedure benefits are not available under this plan.

---- Plan Tiers Breakdown (Plan 200) ----

Now, let's look at Plan 200. This tier provides hospital confinement benefits of two hundred dollars per day and ICU confinement benefits of two hundred dollars per day. Emergency room visits remain at fifty dollars per visit, and physician's office visits are fifty dollars per visit. Additionally, this plan includes coverage for X-rays and labs, as well as advanced diagnostic services.

---- Plan Tiers Breakdown (Plan 200+) ----

Continuing with Plan 200+, this tier offers the same hospital and ICU confinement benefits as Plan 200, at two hundred dollars per day. Emergency room and physician's office visits are covered at fifty dollars per visit. This plan also includes surgery benefits, along with X-rays, labs, and advanced diagnostic services.

---- Plan Tiers Breakdown (Plan 300) ----

Next, we have Plan 300. This plan increases hospital and ICU confinement benefits to three hundred dollars per day. Emergency room visits are still fifty dollars per visit, and physician's office visits are fifty dollars per visit. Surgery benefits, X-rays, labs, and advanced diagnostic services are included in this plan.

---- Plan Tiers Breakdown (Plan 500) ----

Plan 500 offers even greater benefits, with hospital and ICU confinement coverage at five hundred dollars per day. Emergency room visits are fifty dollars per visit, and physician's office visits are fifty dollars per visit. This plan also includes surgery benefits, X-rays, labs, and advanced diagnostic services.

---- Plan Tiers Breakdown (Plan 750) ----

Plan 750 provides hospital and ICU confinement benefits of seven hundred fifty dollars per day. Emergency room visits are covered at seventy-five dollars per visit, and physician's office visits are fifty dollars per visit. Surgery benefits, X-rays, labs, and advanced diagnostic services are part of this plan.

---- Plan Tiers Breakdown (Plan 1000) ----

Plan 1000 offers hospital and ICU confinement benefits of one thousand dollars per day. Emergency room visits are one hundred dollars per visit, and physician's office visits are seventy-five dollars per visit. This plan includes surgery benefits, X-rays, labs, and advanced diagnostic services.

---- Plan Tiers Breakdown (Plan 1000+) ----

Finally, Plan 1000+ provides the same hospital and ICU confinement benefits as Plan 1000, at one thousand dollars per day. Emergency room visits are one hundred dollars per visit, and physician's office visits are seventy-five dollars per visit. This plan also includes hospital admission benefits, surgery benefits, X-rays, labs, and advanced diagnostic services.

---- Comparing Plan Tiers ----

Let's compare the different tiers available. As you can see in the table, hospital confinement benefits range from one hundred dollars in Plan 100 to one thousand dollars in Plan 1000 and Plan 1000+. ICU confinement follows the same pattern. Emergency room coverage starts at fifty dollars and goes up to one hundred dollars. Surgery benefits are available starting from Plan 200+.

---- Definitions and Limitations ----

Let's review important definitions and limitations. Pre-existing conditions have a twelve-month waiting period, with exceptions for newborns and adopted children. Exclusions include chiropractic and acupuncture services, as well as cosmetic surgery. Limitations apply to extreme sports injuries and treatments from family members. It's important to note that this coverage is not a substitute for major medical insurance.

---- Key Takeaways and Reminders ----

Here are the key points to remember. The plan offers fixed indemnity benefits and includes access to the Multiplan PPO Network. Direct payment of benefits is available, and enrollment is required to access these features.

---- Closing ----

Thank you for your time today. We hope this information helps you make informed decisions about your health coverage. Thank you for considering Everest Reinsurance Group for your healthcare needs. Continue to be great!
